text.text: How do I set my first accounting period in ZOLL Billing?

text: To set your first accounting period in ZOLL Billing, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, click Accounting Periods 2. After you read the help information, click Set my starting period 3. Click the radio bullet next to a starting period date 4. Scroll down to the bottom of the list and click Make this my starting period.

text.text: Can you explain how ZOLL Billing handles recording charges, payments, and adjustments in accounting periods?

text: ZOLL Billing automatically records all posted charges, payments, and adjustments to the appropriate monthly accounting period. Managers can use the information in the accounting periods to reconcile billing charges, transactions, and adjustments with monthly closing reports.

text.text: Where can I find the option to set my starting period in ZOLL Billing?

text: You can find the option to set your starting period in ZOLL Billing by clicking Accounting Periods on the navigation bar.

text.text: What should I do after clicking on the Accounting Periods option on the navigation bar?

text: After clicking on the Accounting Periods option on the navigation bar, you will see a list of every accounting period since you started using ZOLL Billing. You can change the starting period at any time until you close your first period. After you set the starting period, the system ignores the data of all the previous periods.

text.text: Is there any guidance provided when setting the starting period for the first time in ZOLL Billing?

text: Yes, the system provides help and guidance the first time you go through the closing process. You can find the option to set your starting period by clicking Accounting Periods on the navigation bar. After you read the help information, click Set my starting period. You can change the starting period at any time until you close your first period. After you set the starting period, the system ignores the data of all the previous periods.

text.text: How do I select a starting period date for my accounting periods?

text: You can select a starting period date by clicking the radio bullet next to a starting period date. You can then scroll down to the bottom of the list and click Make this my starting period. When the page reloads, you will see several changes: The "Set my starting period" button changes to "Change my starting period". All periods prior to the period you selected are grayed out and marked "Ignored". You can close accounting periods starting with your starting period.

text.text: What happens after I click the "Make this my starting period" button?

text: When you click the "Make this my starting period" button, the "Set my starting period" button changes to "Change my starting period". All periods prior to the period you selected are grayed out and marked "Ignored".

text.text: Can you clarify the meaning of "Ignored" for periods prior to the selected starting period?

text: When you set the starting period, the system ignores the data of all the previous periods. This means that their balances and balance forward values (marked n/a) do not count. You can close accounting periods starting with your starting period.

text.text: How does setting the starting period affect closing accounting periods in ZOLL Billing?

text: You can only close accounting periods in sequential order - always the oldest period first. You can change the starting period at any time until you close your first period. After you set the starting period, the system ignores the data of all the previous periods.

text.text: Are there any limitations or considerations I should be aware of when setting my starting period?

text: Once you close your first period, you cannot go back and change your starting period. You can only close accounting periods in sequential order - always the oldest period first.

To set your first accounting period, you must select the period you want to set as your starting period. You can change the starting period at any time until you close your first period. After you set the starting period, the system ignores the data of all the previous periods.
